text:
In 2005, I was in business school and 
I got an internship offer from Amazon.
And I actually came out here, to Seattle,
for a kind of an intern sell weekend
and Andy Jassy was there
and he said, we have a new business
that we're starting up.
I can't really tell you anything about it,
but it's heavy on the technology side,
and we think that it has a lot of potential.
I was like, that's the one,
and I've been here ever since.
When I started full-time, it was three people.
I was the product manager for AWS.
And so, we did everything.

I wrote detail pages, I came up with
pricing plans, I did naming meetings.

We all thought that there was
a huge potential for this business

and we didn't really know
how big it was going to be,

but we all kind of saw that there 
was something there and

were really excited about going and 
building and seeing what we could do.

Our number one priority right now
is exactly the same thing it's been

since the very first day that I started,
which is to deliver a secure

and operationally excellent
set of services for our customers.

They are literally trusting us
with their business.
And it has to be up and has to be secure.
And it won't change with me in this role.

There's a lot that's going to be able
to be unlocked with generative AI.
And our job is to,

on all dimensions of generative AI,
go help customers build in that space.

I don't think there's anyone
that can tell you exactly
what 12 months from now looks like.

But for us, we're building that 
platform of building blocks that,

I think will really arm our customers 
to be able to take advantage

of all of the new technologies that 
are going to be coming down the line.
